definition.title: What Makes a Great Newsletter?
definition.content: Great newsletters feel like a note from a smart friend. They have a compelling subject line, open with personality, deliver clear value, and end with a specific action. The best ones are consistent, scannable, and respect the reader's time.

tips: Write the subject line last - it's easier to summarize once you know the content
Open with personality - show you're human, not a faceless brand; share a quick personal note
One main idea - the best newsletters are focused; save other ideas for next week
Make it scannable - use headers, bullets, and bold text so readers can skim

faq.question: How long should my newsletter be?
faq.answer: 5-10 minute read is ideal. Keep it valuable and scannable. Quality over quantity always wins.

faq.question: How often should I send newsletters?
faq.answer: Weekly is the sweet spot for most. Consistency matters more than frequency. Pick a schedule you can maintain.

faq.question: What structure works best?
faq.answer: Hook intro → Main content → Takeaways → CTA. Use headers and bullet points for scannability.

faq.question: How do I grow my subscriber list?
faq.answer: Create a compelling lead magnet, optimize signup forms, promote on social, and make your existing newsletters shareable.
